      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean addRecord(java.lang.String strTable, java.lang.String strKeyName, java.lang.String strKeyContents)
      The addRecord method checks to see if a specific record already exists in the database and if it doesn't, it adds it.
      void close()
      The close method basically tells the database to write everything to disk and clear the cache

      java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String strFieldName) 
      java.lang.Boolean moreRecords()
      First you run the query, then you loop through the database checking each time to see if there are any moreRecords()
      java.lang.Boolean openConnection(java.lang.String strDataSourceName)
      the openConnection method accepts the Data Source Name of the database then looks for a Java Derby connector
      java.lang.Boolean query(java.lang.String strSQL)
      the query method asks the database for information but does not make any changes to the database.
      java.lang.Boolean setField(java.lang.String strTable, java.lang.String strKeyName, java.lang.String strKeyContents, java.lang.String strFieldName, java.lang.String strFieldContents)
      To update a record with multiple fields, you simply call the method once for each field

    • Method Detail

      • addRecord

        java.lang.Boolean addRecord(java.lang.String strTable,
                            java.lang.String strKeyName,
                            java.lang.String strKeyContents)
        The addRecord method checks to see if a specific record already exists in the database and if it doesn't, it adds it. If the record already exists, it just skips over all of the code
        Parameters:
        strTable - - the table
        strKeyName - - the key name
        strKeyContents - - the key contents of the key field
        Returns:
        - true or fail;

      • close

        void close()
        The close method basically tells the database to write everything to disk and clear the cache

      • execute

        java.lang.Boolean execute(java.lang.String strSQL)
        In some cases you need to create a database from scratch. To do that we need to have a function that allows changes to the database
        Parameters:
        strSQL - - SQL
        Returns:
        - true or false

      • moreRecords

        java.lang.Boolean moreRecords()
        First you run the query, then you loop through the database checking each time to see if there are any moreRecords()
        Returns:
        - returns TRUE if there are more records and FALSE if there are not

      • openConnection

        java.lang.Boolean openConnection(java.lang.String strDataSourceName)
        the openConnection method accepts the Data Source Name of the database then looks for a Java Derby connector
        Parameters:
        strDataSourceName - - the Data Source Name of the database

      • setField

        java.lang.Boolean setField(java.lang.String strTable,
                           java.lang.String strKeyName,
                           java.lang.String strKeyContents,
                           java.lang.String strFieldName,
                           java.lang.String strFieldContents)
        To update a record with multiple fields, you simply call the method once for each field
        Parameters:
        strTable - - the table
        strKeyName - - the key name
        strKeyContents - - the key contents of the key field
        strFieldName - - the field name
        strFieldContents - - the contents of the key field
